Board Chair Kadow refuses request for “correction to the draft minutes”

May 14th, 2007

At the May 10, 2007, Board of Trustee meeting, Board Chair Eugene Kadow refused to accept Trustee Motte’s correction to the draft minutes of April 12, 2007.

At the April 12, 2007, Board of Trustee meeting, Trustee Motte read into the minutes and distributed a prepared formal statement to the board which clarified the board’s reported closed session action of March 8, 2007, concerning Mark Zacovic’s contract. That statement was not made part of or attached to the draft minutes for approval.

An important paragraph of that statement is as follows as it clarifies the vote reported concerning Dr. Zacovic’s contract at MSJC.

“At the meeting held on March 8, 2007, the Board had already acted to terminate Dr. Zacovic. The only vote that was taken and reported out of closed session at that meeting was a vote to assure that Dr. Zacovic received the full benefits of his contract with MSJC, including salary through May 14, 2007 and eighteen months severance pay. Trustee McGargill and I voted as we did, not to ratify or support what I believe to be the unwarranted and illegal termination of Dr. Zacovic, but to assure that MSJC at a minimum honored the contract terms which Dr. Zacovic was hired.”

Blog:

Section 54957.5 (b) of the Brown Act, clearly states the following concerning writings that are public records of a public meeting.

“Writings that are public records under subdivision (a) and that are distributed during a public meeting shall be made available for public inspection at the meeting if prepared by the local agency or a member of its legislative body, or after the meeting if prepared by some other person.”

Why didn’t the Chair allow the prepared and read statement as part of the public record of the April 12. 2007 BOT meeting? The document was clearly a“writing distributed during a public meeting”. The above code was read aloud to Mr. Kadow at the meeting, and still Mr. Kadow and Trustee Schlange refused to allow the statement as an attachment of the draft minutes. Trustee Sparkman was not present to vote and named Interim S/P JTyler made no comment concerning the matter.

The motion to approve the minutes as corrected and attach Motte’s statement was seconded by Trustee McGargill but failed on a 2-2 vote. The motion to approve the minutes of the BOT meeting of April 12, 2007, failed on a 2-2 vote.
